discussion.content:
I would go for 1, 1, 1

Tested and verified the "Get state of checkbox" in "Get selected checkboxes in window" action which is straight forward and it is part of UI Automation action as stated in the question

I am looking at the actions in power automate desktop:

Get selected checkboxes in window - this action allows you to select "Get state of checkbox" from the dropdown

Focus Window - The action information in PAD clearly states that it "Actives and brings to the foreground a specific window"

Wait For Window - the description of the action in PAD confirms ths

I choose 1, 1, 1. The "Get selected checkboxes in window" has an action to "Get state of checkbox"
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-automate/desktop-flows/actions-reference/uiautomation#getselectedcheckboxesinwindow

comments.content: Within the 'Get selected radio button in window' you have the option under 'Operation' to 'Get state of radio button'. So the correct answer of question 1 is the first one, not the second.

discussion.content:
Answer is correct; Its 2, 1, 1.

First one is not getting all checkbox details, only the ones that have been selected, but that's not the question.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You are designing automation solutions that interact with a desktop application.
You need to select the appropriate UI automation action for each business requirement.
Which automation action should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
//IMG//

HOTSPOT -
You are automating a form on a website. The website uses the following HTML markup to define each field on the form:
//IMG//

The label for each field is unique in the form.
You need to write data to the form.
For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
//IMG//

comments.content: isnt it the other way around? Only unique selectors can be used to enter a data on the form? Not unique needs wildcards.

discussion.content:
Yes, No, Yes

If you read the line after the HTML, it states that each label is unique. That means you can't use it as a selector without a wildcard.

1 is using the input tag (which it doesn't say is unique)
2 is using the label, which is unique and therefore can't be used.
3 is using the input as well.

I will go with 
N,N,Y
To me the only complete and correct answer #3

Yes. this will selects the input labelField1
No. this will not select labelField1. input is not a child element of label.
No. javascript is not a selector.
this question is vague. please describe the definition of the automation

Honestly this is a poorly worded question, all of them work (all of these selectors are ripped straight from the RPA Challenge website, check em out) but none of them add data to more than 1 field, which this question implies is what we want...?
I think only 3rd one, because with CSS you can only add data through the :: selector if I'm not mistaken.

comments.content: However; I now see that is added: 'The automation will add data to the form'. So then it doesn't matter. It's all about CSS. The first one does seem pretty correct though.

choices.F: The first and last flows run based on the priority and the time requested.
choices.B: The first flow runs on the target device based on the priority and the time requested.
choices.D: The first flow runs on the target device based on Next to run status and time requested.
choices.A: All the flows are run simultaneously.
choices.E: The next flow will run when each run completes based on the priority and the time requested.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
B, C, E is correct

questions.question_text:

Which three rules will Power Automate apply? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

choices.E: Create a cloud flow that uses the When a row is added or modified trigger in Microsoft Dataverse.
choices.D: Use the Populate a Microsoft Word Online (Business) template action in a cloud flow.
choices.B: Use the Convert Word Document to PDF and Send an email actions in a desktop flow.
choices.A: Use the Convert Word Document to PDF and Send an email actions in a cloud flow.

questions.question_text:
You develop automation solutions for a company.
When a new record is added to a Microsoft Dataverse table, the solution must add the contents of the record to a Microsoft Word Online (Business) template. The solution must convert the template to a PDF document and email the PDF document to a stakeholder.
You need to design the solution.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

DRAG DROP -
You are developing automation solutions.
You need to select solution components for each scenario.
Which solution components should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate solution components to the correct requirements. Each solution component may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
//IMG//

discussion.content: I agree with the answer give - process advisor maps out bottle neck. Its nothing to do with flow.

comments.content: Not at this time. It does not analyse the bottlenecks. It checks for errors mostly.

discussion.content: Last one could also be Flow Checker
